arts.ttl: Paul Hurst bemoans officials after Shrewsbury Town suffer eighth loss
arts.sum: "I thought it was excellent (he said about the response) I am not sure I have seen a team play perhaps that well. "We have played well enough tonight to get something from the game," Hurst said.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town 0 Exeter City 2 - Grecians go fourth after another clean sheet win - Devon Live
arts.sum: Substitutes Jack Aitchison and Josh Magennis combined as the experienced striker tapped home from close range – albeit from an offside position – to make it 2-0 and break his duck for the club. Goals in either half gave the Grecians a 2-0 win away to Shrewsbury Town as they made it six unbeaten with a sixth successive clean sheet in front of the Sky TV cameras.

arts.ttl: Gary Caldwell wants to mark 100th Exeter City match in style
arts.sum: “It is something we spoke about early in the season, creating history and trying to be the best team in the club’s history, so if we can add little points along the way, of clean sheets or whatever it is, then that would be great. It’s the longest time I’ve been at any club as the manager and, hopefully, there will be many more years, many more games to come.

arts.ttl: Kamari Doyle and Josh Magennis guide Exeter to victory
Exeter City need to start scoring a few more goals
arts.sum: Likewise, Josh Magennis didn’t make it off the bench when Northern Ireland drew 0-0 in Belarus last week and while he may, by the time you read this, have played some part in Norn Iron’s game at home to Bulgaria on Tuesday, he shouldn’t be too drained ahead of our trip to Gay Meadow. After Ollie’s performances in the Euros, I think pretty much everyone took it as read he would begin against the Greeks – everyone, that is, except England’s interim manager Lee Carsley, who, in the absence of the injured Harry Kane, opted to go without a striker and instead play Jude Bellingham in a false-nine position.

arts.ttl: Exeter City injury latest as Grecians ready to return to action
arts.sum: “It’s been really good,” Caldwell said of the break between the win over Cambridge and tomorrow’s League One return at Shrewsbury Town. Asked where he wanted to see improvement, Caldwell said: “I still think we can be better defensively, even though we’re keeping clean sheets.

arts.ttl: Exeter City looking to make more history after clean sheet run
arts.sum: “People look at clean sheets so it’s been amazing for me to get as many as I’ve had so far,” Whitworth said. Whitworth has played in all nine of Exeter ’s League One games so far this season, keeping an impressive six clean sheets along the way.

arts.ttl: 'He is hugely talented' - Tisdale joins Celtic
arts.sum: Celtic appoint former Exeter City manager Paul Tisdale as their head of football operations.

arts.ttl: Paul Hurst demands a meaner defence from his Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: And speaking after Town’s win at Crawley on Saturday, Hurst said: “I heard their manager talking about them pre-game and his philosophy. The other things are nice, and maybe you will think you have always got a chance in a game but I was disappointed with the goals and the way we defended in the first half of that game.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town duo out of Exeter clash
arts.sum: The international break usually means Town’s players miss one league game, but because their clash against Exeter has been moved forward to Thursday both players are unlikely to feature for two weeks running. The duo have both been representing their national teams over the last week meaning they missed the clash at Crawley on Saturday.
